headline.main: Kennedy's War on Cancer, and Our Own

docs.abstract: What progress has been made in treatment in the last 40 years?
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Edward Kennedy was instrumental in promoting the idea of a "war on cancer," before President Nixon made the medical challenge a public health research priority in 1971. Now nearly 40 years later, Senator Kennedy's death from brain cancer is a reminder that relatively little progress has been made in the cancer death rate in four decades, despite the many billions spent on research.
docs.snippet: What progress has been made in treatment in the last 40 years?
